### Prerequisites

- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

Quote from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/16700#issuecomment-1103474523:

> Technically, Format-List is not affected by this, but colors don't work there either, because when it wraps, the second line gets no formatting, which is _really **gross**_: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/192942/164153654-827ca3b5-fdcf-4439-9673-0b66be0a8d26.png)

And this is done by resizing the window to make the list rendering need to do word wrapping. See https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/16700#issuecomment-1117601312 for details.

### Expected behavior

```console
The wrapped words should keep the same color decoration.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
The wrapped words lost their color decoration.
```

```console
N/A
```
